poem:
Sabre-tooth Dreams  

In the quake of time, a shadowed leap,  
twenty million sunrises past,  
feline divergences whispered deep—  
ancient fangs to kittens cast.  

Now, Tom, eight, inquires of echoes vast,  
as the house cat's gentle nudge  
reminds us all of ancient pasts,  
and the primal purrs we cannot judge.
